introText: As artificial intelligence rapidly advances, millions of jobs face disruption. Rather than fear the inevitable, we must proactively invest in education, implement universal basic income pilots, and create new pathways for workers to thrive in an AI-augmented economy.

content.content: Preparing for AI's impact on employment

AI is not just coming for routine jobsâ€”it's increasingly capable of tasks we thought required human judgment. Customer service, legal research, medical diagnosis, and even creative work are being automated at unprecedented speed.

We need massive investment in education and retraining. Community colleges should offer free credentials in AI-complementary skills. Universal basic income pilots should expand to provide a safety net during transition.
History shows technological transitions create new opportunities. Our task is ensuring those opportunities are accessible to all, not just the already privileged. The time to act is now.
